raw_text:
Singer's film to show at festival
 
 A documentary which takes a candid look at the life of chart-topping singer George Michael will be shown at this year's Berlin Film Festival.
 
 A Different Story will screen in the Panorama section of the festival, which runs from 10-20 February. It features the singer talking about both his career and his personal life, from his days in Wham! through to more recent events. Michael will attend the festival to introduce the screening on 16 February. Director Southan Morris and executive producer Andy Stephens will also attend the festival.
 
 The 93 minute film will see Michael discussing his early days in Wham! along with his later career, including his legal battles with record label Sony and his stance against the Iraq war and American politics. It will also touch upon his turbulent personal life, including his arrest in a Beverly Hills park toilet in 1998 for "lewd behaviour", and the death of his boyfriend Anselmo Feleppa from Aids. The film, which includes previously unseen footage of the singer also features contributions from Michael's former Wham! partner Andrew Ridgeley, as well as ex-Wham! backing singers Pepsi and Shirlie. Other contributors include Sting, Mariah Carey, Elton John, Noel Gallagher, Geri Halliwell and Simon Cowell. This year's festival will open with Man To Man, a historical epic starring Joseph Fiennes and Kristin Scott-Thomas. It will be one of 21 films competing for the festival's top prize, the Golden Bear. Other films in competition will include The Life Aquatic, a quirky comedy starring Bill Murray, and the biopic Kinsey, which features Liam Neeson. The full programme will be announced on 1 February.
llama3.2:1b: A documentary about singer George Michael will screen at this year's Berlin Film Festival. It features Michael talking about his career and personal life. He is set to introduce the screening at the festival.
llama3.2:3b: A documentary about George Michael titled A Different Story will screen at this year's Berlin Film Festival as part of the Panorama section. It features candid footage and discussions with Michael himself, including his time in Wham! and his personal struggles such as a high-profile arrest and loss of his boyfriend to AIDS.
gemma2:2b: George Michael documentary "A Different Story" will premiere at the Berlin Film Festival's Panorama section (February 10-20). The 93 minute film delves into the singer's career and personal life, featuring interviews with Michael, Ridgeley, Pepsi & Shirlie, Sting, Mariah Carey, Elton John, Noel Gallagher, Geri Halliwell, and Simon Cowell.  The documentary will be introduced by Michael himself at a screening on February 16th.  It also includes previously unseen footage of the singer and contributions from various artists.

Director Southan Morris and exec producer Andy Stephens attend the festival. Film will screen in Panorama section from 10-20 Feb with Michael's participation on 16 Feb. Festival opens with historical epic "Man To Man" competing for Golden Bear prize.
qwen2.5:3b: A documentary about George Michael’s life, including his career with Wham! and personal struggles like his legal battles with Sony, arrest in 1998, and death of his boyfriend from AIDS, will screen at this year's Berlin Film Festival. Directed by Southan Morris and produced by Andy Stephens, the film runs for 93 minutes and features contributions from Michael’s former bandmate Andrew Ridgeley, backing singers Pepsi and Shirlie, as well as Sting, Mariah Carey, Elton John, Noel Gallagher, Geri Halliwell, Simon Cowell, Joseph Fiennes, Kristin Scott-Thomas, Bill Murray, and Liam Neeson. The festival will open with Man To Man and feature 21 films in competition for the Golden Bear.
